title.native: 杖と剣のウィストリア

description:
A hard-working boy named Will enters a magic academy in hopes of becoming a great sorcerer. Unfortunately, there's a fatal flaw in his plan: he lacks the ability to use magic. Amid the cold stares of his classmates and instructors, Will feels discouraged at times, but he presses forward with unwavering determination. He can't use a wand, but he can wield a sword in his battle to reach the top of a magic-dominated world. He just needs to believe in his own unique strengths and remember the promise he made with someone precious to him...

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Mixed Gender Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several people, regardless of gender, who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujinoomori)

Fujino Oomori is a Japanese author most known for writing the [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) light novel series. 

In early 2013, [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) was submitted to the 4th GA Bunko Award, where it won and received an offer to have it published by Bunko.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".
